verbose_text: In 2001, Mandelboim et al. reported that the hemagglutinin (HA) of the orthomyxovirus H1N1 influenza virus and the hemagglutinin-neuraminidase (HN) of the paramyxovirus Sendai virus, both expressed on the surface of infected cells, are recognized by NKp46, and thereby trigger the lysis of infected cells by NK cells.
